title: Castelfeder 2014 Raif Sauvignon (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This opens with classic varietal scents of cut grass, hay, tomato vine, honeydew melon and a whiff of sage. The elegant palate offers pink grapefruit, peach and a mineral note alongside a backbone of crisp acidity.

title: Bottega Vinai 2014 Zeveri Müller-Thurgau (Trentino Superiore)
description: Aromas of fragrant white wildflower, citrus peel and yellow stone fruit lead the way. The vibrant palate offers apricot, yellow peach and tangerine alongside zesty acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Clavo Cellars 2011 Reckless Moment Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Dank tree roots, marjoram and tart elderberries show on the nose on this bottling. The body is thinner than expected, with a pleasant herbal character of oregano, thyme, rosemary and lavender giving nuance to the dried-blueberry backbone.

title: Cliffhanger 2013 Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: Ripe orchard fruit, white and yellow flower aromas blend together on this vibrant, refreshing white. The bright palate doles out crisp Granny Smith apple and a mineral note accompanied by tangy acidity.

title: Cruz Alta 2012 Grand Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Plum and berry aromas are floral and suggestive of perfumed soap. This has a friendly, easy mouthfeel and limited but good flavors of spiced plum and raspberry. A mild, low-tannin finish leaves a peppery aftertaste.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Choreography Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A collaboration with figure skater Peggy Fleming, this wine has a tight and mineral nose that shows aromas of lemon curds, salted lime butter and mandarin orange. The palate is racy with kumquat and tangerine pith flavors, disclosing gray slate and sour citrus before settling into a browned-butter finish.

title: Del Rio 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)
description: A fine effort in 2014, this offers complex herbal aromatics of dill, lemon verbena and pineapple sage. It's smooth and lightly toasty, with round fruit flavors of apple and peach, leading into a pleasantly toasty finish.

title: Dom Ponciano 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
description: With a few months aging, the baby freshness of this wine has turned into ripe fruit with fresh apricot as well as citrus flavors. It's a bright wine, of course, full of lively acidity while having this extra layer of richness that comes from ripe Alvarinho. Drink now.

title: Shady Lane 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: This wine shows dusty-earth aromas over ripe red cherry and raspberry. The light-bodied palate is silken in feel, with soft tannins that build upon flavors of red plum skin, currants and pink peppercorns.

title: Trentadue 2013 La Storia Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Black fruit, leather pouch and a lightness of black pepper mark this block-designated wine. Integrated in terms of oak, it features a shot of gunpowder on the finish.

title: Treos 2014 Dry Muscat (Willamette Valley)
description: Here the intense floral accents lean toward oranges, as this is comprised of two different Muscat varieties. It's dry but not dull, with citrus aromas and a palate of peach, apricot and papaya.

title: Vincent Price 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This thick, rich and gravelly wine comes from a great vineyard site in the coolness of the Petaluma Gap. Crème brûlée and lemon pith duke it out for dominance, finishing in a tie.

title: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Klausner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Honeysuckle, tropical fruit and pear aromas lead the nose. Made with forty-year-old vines, the elegantly structured palate delivers crisp apple, white almond and mineral alongside vibrant acidity.

title: Weinhof Kobler 2014 Oberfeld Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Pear and spring flower aromas lead the way on this vibrant white. The bright palate offers yellow apple, candied lemon zest and a touch of mineral alongside fresh acidity that leaves a clean finish.

title: Tercic 2013 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)
description: This lively white opens with aromas of peach blossom, crushed stone and whiff of toasted nut while the linear palate shows yellow peach, lemon zest and vibrant acidity. A mineral note closes the finish.

title: Schmidt 2011 Malbec (Southern Oregon)
description: The high alcohol is a good indication of the ultraripe fruit flavors here. Raisins and cooked cherries dominate, set against a background of tart cherry-pie acids. The concentration is impressive, as is the purity of the fruit flavors.

title: Segal's 2014 Fusion White (Galilee)
description: This wine offers aromas of pineapple, melon and rose petal. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of pear, toasted pineapple and Turkish delight. The finish is marked by a touch of bright kiwi flavor and lingering florals.

title: Kupel Wieser 2014 Alfio Moriconi Selection Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Fruity and fresh, this opens with scents of apple orchard and a whiff of citrus zest. The refined, straightforward palate offers pear and a touch of mineral alongside bright acidity. It closes crisp and clean.

title: Primosic 2014 Poderi di Carlo Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: A delicate fragrance of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a hint of light baking spice lead the way. Boasting copper-colored reflections, the lithe palate shows off crisp green apple, nectarine and a mineral note buoyed by racy acidity.

title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Lab Premium Red (Douro)
description: Winemaker Francisco Olazabal, from Quinta do Vale Meão is behind this ripe, fruity and stylishly fresh wine. It's a classic blend of Douro grapes with the addition of Sousão (apparent from the dark color and high acidity). It's a wine that would be worth aging a few months, so wait until late 2016 to drink.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Malbec (Applegate Valley)
description: Though the winery claims just 10% new French oak was used, the impact of smoky, charred wood is clear. Some bright, tart raspberry fruit is at the core. The tannins carry flavors of coffee grounds and dark chocolate.

title: S.A. Prüm 2014 Essence Riesling (Mosel)
description: Crisp, cutting lime and lemon lend verve to crisp green apple and pear flavors in this fruity, fresh Riesling. It's approachable and refreshing, slicked with subtle honey and spice tones. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Uvaggio 2013 Zelo Rosso Red (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: This is a bold combination of 89% Dolcetto from the Napa side of Carneros and 11% Barbera from one of its happy spots in the state, El Dorado County. Big bodied and tannic on entry, it softens in the glass to reveal bright red cherry and spearmint, with a touch of bitterness on the finish.

title: Venica & Venica 2014 Ronco delle Cime Friulano (Collio)
description: This opens with notes of toasted walnut, yellow flower and orchard fruit. The fresh, elegant palate delivers yellow apple, mineral and bitter almond alongside bright acidity.

title: Westerly 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Light notes of cut lemongrass and squeezed lemon show on the nose of this wine by former Harlan Estates cellar master Adam Henkel. Lime juice, wet cement and apple peels combine for a standard and straightforward flavor profile, which is clean, tight and packs a good acidic sizzle.

title: Airlie 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented Dijon clones make for a full-bodied wine with plenty of grip. It's fruity with chewy melon and ripe peach. Just 8% of the oak was new, but light, buttery notes soften up the finish.

title: Andeluna 2013 Altitud Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: Oily citrus and barrel-based smoke aromas set up a palate that's deep and powerful. Flavors of spiced apple, citrus and butterscotch are solid and don't fade over the course of a long, slightly pithy tasting finish.

title: Apriori 2014 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rustic on the nose, this is an earthy, herb-filled wine made in a robust style, juicy and exhibiting glassfuls of rhubarb and black tea. Integrated in terms of oak and tannin, it's youthful and may need some time to grow.

title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Fresh and juicy, this wine is packed with a black currant flavor. It has enough firm tannins to give it shape and structure. The acidity is enmeshed in the structure, just a hint for now.

title: Clavo Cellars 2011 Desperado Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Rustic aromas of leather, cola ,black cherry and black plum hit the nose on this bottling by longtime vintner Neil Roberts. The palate boasts hearty and rugged flavors of elk roast and wild-game jerky, which give a savory edge to the tart fruit flavors of boysenberry and elderberry.
